Temporal Point Processes for information diffusion in social networks

This project is part of my PhD thesis, and focuses on the interplay between the dynamics of information diffusion in social networks and the content of the information spread. To model this, we use Multidimensional Marked Hawkes Processes, which are a class of Temporal Point Processes. The article can be found here: Uncovering Social Network Activity Using Joint User and Topic Interaction.
